sub_title: PhD candidate in Jurisprudence at Leiden University | International law, international relations, legal philosophy
summary:
I am a researcher and lecturer at the Department of Jurisprudence, where I am preparing a doctoral thesis on the application of moral and political philosophy to the question of unreliable and illiberal actors in international law and international relations.

I studied Law (LLB), Public International Law (LLM) and Jurisprudence and Philosophy of Law (LLM) at Leiden University. My joint master's thesis was supervised by Prof. Bastiaan Rijpkema and Dr. Letizia Lo Giacco and dealt with the relation between Immanuel Kant's legal philosophy and the right to self-determination in international law.

During my studies I worked as a student assistant at the Europa Institute, editing the book reviews for the Common Market Law Review. I was also for several years an editor of the faculty magazine NOVUM, of which he was editor in chief in 2020-2021, and taught working groups for first-year students.

My main research interests are the legal and political philosophy of Immanuel Kant and neo-Kantian legal philosophy, the history and theory of international law, and public law more broadly understood. I  also have an interest in EU constitutional and external relations law and the law of international organizations.

As the student assistant to the Editorial Board I am responsible for the book reviews, of which approximately fifteen are published per issue. I work on the entire book review process: I order review copies, find and contact potential reviewers, send the books, edit the reviews once they arrive and put them together for publication in the Review.

Aside from book reviews, I am responsible for the annual index, in which all articles that have been published in the Review during the past year are catalogued; I compile the survey of literature, which is published twice a year and catalogues all journal articles on EU law that have appeared in a large number of journals in the past six months; and I write the 'Book Notices' section, in which books that did not get a full review get a brief description.", 'title': 'Student-assistant at the Editorial Office of the Common Market Law Review', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Leiden, Zuid-Holland, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Leiden University', 'description': '‚Ä¢	Taught working groups to first-year bachelor students in law in the course ‚ÄòIntroduction to legal methodology‚Äô, which aims to introduce students to philosophy of science and legal theory.
